poke.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to quickly push your finger or some other pointed object into something or someone
poke.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Be careful with that umbrella or you’ll poke someone in the eye.
poke somebody in the eye/arm/ribs etc
Andy poked the fish with his finger to see if it was still alive.
He was poking at the dust with a stick, making little patterns.
poke.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to move or push something through a space or opening
poke.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He poked a hand into one of his pockets.
One of the nurses poked her head around the door.
poke.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if something is poking through or out of something else, you can see part of it but not all of it
poke.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Ella looked at the tiny face poking out of the blanket.
Weeds had started poking through the cracks in the patio.
poke.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to show someone on a social networking site that you want to communicate with them
poke.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to have sex with a woman
poke.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a criticism of someone or something
poke.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Bennett took a poke at the president’s refusal to sign the bill.
poke.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the act of showing someone on a social networking site that you want to communicate with them
